results.title: Sequence and story
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George Johnson and Don White
results.brief_description:
In this film a group of children manipulate reality using a series of photographs of their own activities. As they lay out the photos in different sequences, the story of their day changes. Simple, realistic dialogue and a combination of live action and still photographs capture the viewer’s imagination.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Sequel to Surtsey
results.brief_description: Shows the volcanic activity of the island of Surtsey near Iceland throughout 1965-l966. Submarine eruptions create the temporary neighbouring islands of Syrtlingur and Jolnir, reduced to shoals soon after they cease erupting. After a quiescent period new eruptions begin on Surtsey itself. Meanwhile scientific investigations continue, a permanent base is established and plant life appears. A continuation of the film Birth of an Island (502828).

results.title: September spring
results.creator_credit: Cinesound, World Wide Pictures, James Carr and John Haggarty
results.brief_description: Deals with the objects of the Snowy Mountains Hydro-Electric Authority. Includes scenes of Melbourne and Sydney, working in the Snowy area, and irrigation in the Griffith area of New South Wales.

results.title: September 11 news footage
results.brief_description: The world held its breath as two hijacked planes were crashed into the World Trade Center in New York City on 11 September 2001. TV networks around the world bore witness and millions of people saw the historic event unfold in real time.
results.description: The world held its breath as two hijacked planes were crashed into the World Trade Center in New York City on 11 September 2001. TV networks around the world bore witness and millions of people saw the historic event unfold in real time.

results.title: September 11
results.brief_description: The world held its breath as two hijacked planes were crashed into the World Trade Center in New York City on 11 September 2001. TV networks around the world bore witness and millions of people saw the historic event unfold in real time.

constellations_primary.name: Post-9/11
constellations_primary.description: The attacks on the World Trader Center in New York City on September 11 2001 were viewed on live television by audiences around the world. The effects of the attack have been explored across various forms of media.

constellations_other.name: Spectacle
constellations_other.description: The moving image has captured some of history’s biggest moments. From newsreel shorts in cinemas before the show to the arrival of TV, nightly news and the 24-hour news cycle to social media, news has become a spectacle.

results.title: September '51
results.creator_credit: Australian Film and Television School and Raymond Quint
results.brief_description:
Looks at the Menzies LCP government’s attempt to ban the Communist Party in Australia in the referendum of 1951 through the dramatic portrayal of the life of a young couple who are members of the party. Highlights the near hysterical atmosphere of this period in Australia’s history.
Cast includes Martin Vaughn, Barry Otto and John Howard.

results.title: Sept Jours Ailleurs
results.brief_description:
A chronicle of the life of a young couple, doubling as a realistic portrait of urban and social conditions in France on the eve of May 68

Credits: Director, Marin Karmitz ; writers, Marin Karmitz, Catherine Martin ; photography, Sylvain du Pasquier ; music, Jacky Moreau ; choreography, Dirk Sanders.
Cast: Jacques Higelin, Vivianne Chiffre, Sonia Filatof, Vladanka Langofer, Yvonne Mestre, Fabienne Pradal, Christine Reynolds.

results.title: Separate tables
results.creator_credit: Clifton Productions, Harold Hecht and Delbert Mann
results.brief_description: This sensitive character study, set in an English seaside hotel, looks at human frailties as seen through the eyes of a small group of residents, many tortured by emotional turmoil and unhappy pasts. Stars Rita Hayworth, Deborah Kerr and Burt Lancaster including Academy Award performances by David Niven and Wendy Hiller for Best Actor and Best Supporting Actress. Based on the play by Terence Rattigan.

results.title: Sentinels of silence
results.creator_credit: Producciones Concord, Manuel Arango and Robert Amram
results.brief_description: Depicts aspects of pre-Columbian monumental architecture in Mexico. Provides a basis for a subjective appreciation of early Mesoamerican cultures. Stimulates interest in early American civilisations. Encourages further study of pre-Columbian cultures. Narrated by Orson Welles. (Awards: Academy Award for Best Short Documentary; Academy Award for Best Live Action Short)
